Class online.common.exCanvas extends java.awt.Canvas implements Serializable

Serialized Fields

idleTime

int idleTime
the number of milliseconds since the mouse last moved on this window

idleTimeout

int idleTimeout
after this number of milliseconds, the helptext tooltip may appeae

lastMouseTime

long lastMouseTime
the time when the mouse last moved.

deferredEvents

online.common.deferredEventManager deferredEvents
asynchronous events such as menu selections and input from the network should be synchronized with the game even loop using the deferredEvents queue

runThread

java.lang.Thread runThread
this is the thtead executing the viewerRun method. Since the basic model requires that everything happens in this thread, code where you suspect "leakage" in to other processes can check.

See Also:
ViewerRun()

theChat

online.common.commonChatApplet theChat
the chat window associated with this window

sharedInfo

online.common.exHashtable sharedInfo
a #exHashtable of things shared among many parts of the program. In games, this is primarily used for parameters passed from the lobby.

theRoot

online.common.RootAppletProtocol theRoot
the root applet for the game. Some image and sound operations have to be provided by the applet. There are also some error reporting utilities here.

s

online.common.internationalStrings s
this contains the translations for all the messages in the user interface.

showStats

javax.swing.JCheckBoxMenuItem showStats

myFrame

online.common.LFrameProtocol myFrame
the frame we live in. This is primarily used as the focus for a few permanant menu items.

extraactions

boolean extraactions
if true, include some extra actions usefor for debugging locally.

cache_images

boolean cache_images
if true, use the image cache to draw artwork.

useCache

javax.swing.JCheckBoxMenuItem useCache

highlightPoint

online.common.HitPoint highlightPoint

dragPoint

online.common.HitPoint dragPoint
this is the x,y of the start of the current drag operation. It's used mainly to calibrare "drag board" operations.

a bold font for random use.

a larger bold font for random use.

labelColor

Class online.common.HitPoint extends java.awt.Point implements Serializable

Serialized Fields

helpText

java.lang.String helpText
if not null, the help text to be draw in in a bubble. Drawing is normally done by DrawArrow if the mouse has not moved for a while

hitObject

java.lang.Object hitObject
the object "hit" by the mouse. This is determined entirely by the paintCanvas routine and interpreted solely by the canvas. It's usually some interesting object such as a board cell or a rectangle.

col

char col
conventionally, the board column hit by the mouse.

row

int row
conventionally, the board row hit by the mouse.

hitCode

int hitCode
an integer code indicating the object hit by the mouse. negative numbers are usually sustem defined codes.

HitNoWhere is the code for nothing identified as hit yet. Various stock widgets use other negative values. You should use positive values for your hitcodes.

dragging

boolean dragging
true if the hit object has been picked up and is being dragged around by the mouse. This is independant of if the mouse button is currently down or up.

The canvas startDragging method should set this flag if this kind of pickup event has occurred.

See Also:
StartDragging, StopDragging(online.common.HitPoint), paintCanvas(java.awt.Graphics, boolean, online.common.HitPoint)

down

boolean down
true if the mouse button is currently down.

arrow

online.common.StockArt arrow
when the mouse is determined to be pointing at something that can be picked up or dropped, set this to a piece of StockArt to be displayed. You must also set HitPoint.awidth to a suitable size, and (eventually) call DrawArrow to actuallly do the drawing.

See Also:
StockArt

awidth

int awidth
the width of the StockArt rectangle. If HitPoint.arrow is not null, awidth must also be set to a reasonable value.

See Also:
DrawArrow

a_x

int a_x
the x offset to display the Stockart, which will default to the mouse position

See Also:
DrawArrow

a_y

int a_y
the y offset to display the StockArt, which will default to the mouse position

See Also:
DrawArrow

hit_x

int hit_x
the center x of the hit object, which will default to the mouse location

hit_y

int hit_y
the center y of the hit object, which will default to the mouse location

hit_width

int hit_width
the width of the sensitive area when hit

hit_height

int hit_height
the height of the sensitive area when hit

highlightColor

java.awt.Color highlightColor
if not null, a highlight rectangle is drawn with this color
